com.skobbler.ngx.map

Class SKMapSurfaceView

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • android.view.SurfaceView
        • android.opengl.GLSurfaceView
          • com.skobbler.ngx.map.SKMapSurfaceView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.opengl.GLSurfaceView.EGLConfigChooser, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, android.view.SurfaceHolder.Callback, java.util.Observer

    public class SKMapSurfaceView
extends android.opengl.GLSurfaceView
implements android.opengl.GLSurfaceView.EGLConfigChooser, java.util.Observer
    Class that constructs a map surface view. Any call to this class must be done only after SKMapSurfaceListener#onSurfaceCreated() was notified.
    Version:
    3.0.2

      • preserveGLContext

        public static boolean preserveGLContext
        Default value is true. If multiple map instances need to be supported then this has to be set to false before setContentView is called for the layout containing the first map . This can be done once when starting the application.

      • transparentMapView

        public static boolean transparentMapView

      • mapVisible

        protected static boolean mapVisible
        Default value is true. Will be set to false when the map is not visible.

                    int duration)

        Parameters:
        angle - angle to rotate the map
        smooth - make the transition smooth
        duration - duration in milliseconds. If the duration is -1 then the zoom animation will have no fixed duration to complete.

                           int duration)
        Centers the map at current position
        Parameters:
        zoom - zoom of the map.
        smooth - if true the centering will be done smooth, false otherwise.
        duration - duration in milliseconds for animating the positioning.

      • addAnnotation

        public void addAnnotation(SKAnnotation annotation,
                 SKAnimationSettings animationSettings)
        Adds an annotation.
        Parameters:
        annotation - model object of the annotation. For further details see SKAnnotation
        animationSettings - animation settings for adding the annotation.

        There are two types of annotations that can be added :

        1. Annotation using texture id , from the json file ( see daystyle.json): 
          
                
         SKAnnotation annotation = new SKAnnotation(10);
         annotation.setLocation(new SKCoordinate(-122.4200, 37.7765));
         annotation.setMininumZoomLevel(5);
         annotation.setAnnotationType(SKAnnotation.SK_ANNOTATION_TYPE_RED);
         mapView.addAnnotation(annotation, SKAnimationSettings.ANIMATION_NONE);
        2. Annotation using a custom view: 
             
         SKAnnotation annotationFromView = new SKAnnotation(15);
         annotationFromView.setLocation(new SKCoordinate(-122.423573, 37.761349));
         annotationFromView.setMininumZoomLevel(5);
         SKAnnotationView annotationView = new SKAnnotationView();
         customView =
                 (RelativeLayout) ((LayoutInflater) getSystemService(Context.LAYOUT_INFLATER_SERVICE)).inflate(
                         R.layout.layout_custom_view, null, false);
         annotationView.setView(customView);
         annotationFromView.setAnnotationView(annotationView);
         mapView.addAnnotation(annotationFromView, SKAnimationSettings.ANIMATION_NONE);
 
     
      Note: If you want to add multiple annotations with the same custom view  annotationView.setReuseIdentifierWithId(String reuseIdentifierWithId)  can be used (the same reuseIdentifierWithId for each annotation).
     The custom view will be cached and reused, otherwise the view will be recreated every time an annotation is added.

      • updateAnnotation

        public void updateAnnotation(SKAnnotation annotation)
        Updates an existing annotation.
        Parameters:
        annotation - the annotation that needs to be updated.

        Please check addAnnotation(SKAnnotation, SKAnimationSettings) to see what types of annotations can be added/updated and what fields have to be set for each type of annotation.

        Returns:
